alert.note: Alert for Harris; Meriwether; Talbot; Troup (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 8:33AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Meriwether, southeastern Troup, northwestern Talbot and Harris Counties through 900 AM EDT... At 832 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Lake Harding, or 9 miles southeast of Valley, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Manchester, Pine Mountain, Warm Springs, F.d. Roosevelt State Park, Mountain Hill, Durand, Harris City, Flint Hill, Mulberry Grove, Whitesville-Pine Lake and Lake Harding. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
